title: Use fixed (with `=` prefix) versions for unstable (before 1.0) dependencies
body: Dependencies that didn't reach `1.0` version can (more often) bring breaking changes in patch releases. Fixed versions are used to prevent situations with unexpected (and uncontrollable) breakage.

title: Make storage error constructor private (pub crate)
body: There is no need for user to construct storage errors. Additionally, we treat such errors specifically during transactions execution and this mechanic can be misused.

title: Fix node round race [ECR-1280]
body:
PR #680 didn't solved problem completely, since `add_round_timeout` wasn't called after `jump_to_round`.
This PR fixes it.

Also findings from the previous PR were fixed.

title: Fixed calculation of max byzantine nodes amount [ECR-1280]
body:
Initial problem: with only 3 nodes started, if two of them gets disconnected and one restores after some time, it can't reach working node round.

The reason: incorrect max byzantine nodes amount calculation. It was calculated as (1/3) of all validators, while it should have been (1/3)-1.

After this fix, reconnected node can reach actual round without any problem.

---

I've tried to write a test for this behavior, but didn't succeed. As far as I can see, sandbox doesn't provide functionality to emulate node disconnect. Is there any way to emulate such a behavior?

title: Cli maintenance mode [ECR-1378]
body:
Instead of unsafe api it was proposed to create CLI command for the same purpose.

In this PR basic `maintenance` command was added to CLI with possibility of extension.

Currently the only supported command is `clear-cache`.

title: Core private API CORS support [ECR-1261]
body:
Added `CorsMiddleware` to `create_private_api_handler` by `create_public_api_handler`'s example. 
Now method `create_private_api_handler` takes `config: &NodeApiConfig` parameter.
Do this changes are enough to support CORS in private API and do we need to test it and how?

title: Add execute method in Service trait [ECR-651]
Fix handling of shutdown request [ECR-1255]
body:
The problem was caused by creating `Iron` handlers in separate threads.
Since those handlers won't stop without request, `join` call on them had no effect.

More than that, as creation of those handlers is non-blocking, there is no need in additional threads.

title: Reject processed transactions [ECR-1251]
body:
With only one node used, it was possible to execute the same transaction multiple times.
To prevent this, additional check was added into NodeHandler::handle_tx.

However, client gets response with tx_hash even for rejected transaction (and this behavior persists even when 2+ nodes are used).
I see no simple way to change it since NodeHandler::handle_tx doesn't return Result and thus not able to tell that transaction was rejected.

title: Implement fmt::Debug for RawTransaction [ECR-996]
body:
`RawTransaction` now has own implementation of `fmt::Debug` trait instead
  of `#[derive(Debug)]`. The template of `RawTransaction`’s debug message is
  `Transaction { version: #, service_id: #, message_type: #, length: #, hash: Hash(###) }`

title: Fix test_network_reconnect on windows. [ECR-446]
body:
**Problem:**

`test_network_reconnect` fails on Windows.

When we drop TestHandler, the outgoing `TcpStream` in `ConnectionsPool::connect_to_peer()` is not dropped and therefore we never receive `NetworkEvent::PeerDisconnected`. Problem with 
`mio::sys::windows::Selector`, issue is described here: https://github.com/carllerche/mio/issues/776

```
drop(t2);
assert_eq!(t1.wait_for_disconnect(), second);
```

Possible solutions:
* disconnect first handler from second and then drop.
* disable test on windows.
* patch mio crate.

I decided to disconnect from the second handler.

title: Update contributing.md and reorder imports accordingly [ECR-1120]

Changed signature of method with_description in ExecutionError structure to

Now we can pass &str arguments to this function.

body: Put the periods, rephrase the last sentence.

title: Implement `Display` for public sodium types
body:
According to [documentation](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/string/trait.ToString.html) 
> ToString shouldn't be implemented directly: Display should be implemented instead, and you get the ToString implementation for free.

Also I refactored types usage according to @vitvakatu [comment](https://github.com/exonum/exonum/pull/318#issuecomment-377505152) (not sure if I made it as it was supposed to).

There are explicit [usages](https://github.com/exonum/exonum/blob/master/testkit/tests/counter/main.rs#L567) of `Hash::to_string` with `format!`. Now it can be removed but I am not sure if we should make it.

title: Apply formatting by rustfmt-preview [ECR-779]

labels.name: discussion :speech_balloon:
labels.description: The design isn't finalized yet, feel free to participate in the discussion.

body:
[Previously](https://github.com/exonum/exonum/pull/558) I was against applying "preview" formatting so soon. :upside_down_face: Now I highly like that idea because of "[nested import groups](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/47948)" feature. So here is the plan:
- Apply new formatting.
- Update imports.

I will _gladly_ do the second step too. Additionally, the order of imports is sometimes wrong, so I'm going to fix it according to our [conventions](https://github.com/exonum/exonum/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#conventions).

title: Fix cargo-deadlinks installation [ECR-1083]
body: `cargo-deadlinks` doesn't support `-V` version, but `cargo deadlinks` does.

title: Introduce '--validators-count' parameter to config template. [ECR-905]
body:
Introduce `--validators-count` parameter to config template.

**Use case**: 
```
cryptocurrency generate-template common.toml --validators-count 4
...
cryptocurrency finalize ... --public-configs pub_1.toml pub_2.toml pub_3.toml pub_4.toml
```

If count of provided `pub_*.toml` files differ from `validators-count` panic will be raised.

```
error: Number of validators configs does not match number of validator keys.
```

**For discussion:**
* Method `override_validators_count()` is  probably is not optimal.

title: example: Don't evaluate wallet in block
body:
Hello,

while I was studying the example I noticed that `wallet` is evaluated in block.

I am not sure but it seems like there is no any special reason for that. So, I tried to remove the block and everything still worked fine.

Please, correct me if I am wrong here.

title: Remove network_id from everywhere. [ECR-1016]
body:
`network_id` parameter is no longer needed, therefore we decided to remove it.

This change breaks **cryptocurrency** example and I also updated test json's.

**update:**  we decided to keep `HEADER_LENGTH=10` and reserve zero byte in `RawMessage`.

title: UniqueHash trait

labels.name: discussion :speech_balloon:
labels.description: The design isn't finalized yet, feel free to participate in the discussion.

body:
A slightly different approach to the "`CryptoHash` implementation for `Hash`" [problem](https://github.com/exonum/exonum/pull/562):
- `CryptoHash` is no longer implemented for `Hash`.
- `UniqueHash` trait is introduced.
- Storage uses `UniqueHash` instead of `CryptoHash`.

Organize cryptocurrency example into modules [ECR-993]

Does what the title says: instead of comment delimiters, file is organized into rust modules. Imports in tests were changed accordingly. Names for modules were chosen in accordance (somewhat) to `configuration` service from `exonum-configuration` crate.
#### Important points:
* Imports were split up for each module
* function `new` was created for `CryptocurrencyApi` to fix visibility issues caused by struct construction

title: Refactor testkit get_err method to return ApiError [ECR-990]
body:
Testkit users may want to test against response status codes. In order to make it implementation agnostic, I decided to use `ApiError` as return value for `get_err` method.

Also one more dev dependency for `testkit` has been introduced: https://github.com/SimonSapin/rust-std-candidates/tree/master/matches

It helps a lot with checking destructured `ApiError`s without pattern matching boilerplate.

TODO: write more unit tests for covering `Into<TestkitApiError> for Response` implementation.
